H5712.def: = a large gathering of humans or creatures ► usually for a specific purpose

H7069.def: = action by which humans acquire an animate or inanimate object ◄ by means of a financial transaction or in another way

H7626.def: = stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment

H5159.def: = process by which possessions are transferred from one generation to the next

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H6471.def: = the lower part of the leg beyond the ankle, on which humans or animals stand and with which they walk

H5331.def: poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

H4876.def: = state in which buildings and infrastructure have been totally destroyed

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H7489.def: literally: to make (one's deeds) wrong; hence: = action by which humans behave in an evil or harmful way

H7580.def: = action by which animals, humans, or deities produce a full, deep, prolonged sound as made by a lion; ≈ associated with aggression, but also with suffering

H4150.def: = an action by which two or more parties come together for a particular purpose

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H226.def: = an object that represents and identifies a group of people; in the form of a flag or a metal or wooden board, often with an image; attached to a pole so that it can be carried; used in both military and religious contexts

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H7134.def: = wooden handle with a metal blade, sharpened on one face, perpendicular to the handle; ► used for cutting down trees and shaping timber

H5442.def: = a dense growth of bushes or small trees that look intertwined; ► sometimes functions as a hiding place for animals

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H4605.def: = action by which humans do something to (other) humans or deities that is not in line with the behavior that they committed themselves to

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H1986.def: = action by which humans or animals deliver a blow to an object with their hands, whether or not with the help of an instrument such as a {L:hammer<SDBH:הַלְמוּת>}, or with their feet

H6603.def: = figures or characters engraved on the surface of a hard object, such as stone or metal, with the help of a sharp tool

H3781.def: exact meaning unsure; possibly: = wooden handle with a metal blade, sharpened on one face, perpendicular to the handle

H3597.def: exact meaning unsure; possibly: = iron bar with a flattened end, ► used as a lever

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H4720.def: = part of an object that is considered more holy than the rest

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H2490.def: = action by which priests disqualify themselves for religious service ◄ by unlawful behavior

H4908.def: = location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3238.def: = causative action by which humans cause hardship to other humans

H8313.def: = process by which an object is consumed by fire

H4150.def: = an action by which two or more parties come together for a particular purpose

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H226.def: = an object that represents and identifies a group of people; in the form of a flag or a metal or wooden board, often with an image; attached to a pole so that it can be carried; used in both military and religious contexts

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H5030.def: = male person speaking on behalf of a deity

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H4970.def: = reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H2778.def: = causative action by which humans make an effort to arouse an emotion of shame in (other) humans or deities; ◄ by their words or actions

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H5006.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events, often caused by pride and contempt

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H5331.def: poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3225.def: = the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

H2706.def: = specific actions required by somebody in authority

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H6466.def: = action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen

H3444.def: = causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H5797.def: = state in which an object is able to withstand force

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H8577.def: = mythical sea monster, such as {L:behemoth<SDBH:בְּהֵמֹות>} and {L:leviathan<SDBH:לִוְיָתָן>}

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H7533.def: = causative action by which humans destroy an object by using force to break it into two or more pieces

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H3882.def: = large mythical monster living in the sea and looking like a giant croccodile or similar reptile

H3978.def: = any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth

H6728.def: = boat of a relatively large size; ► able to sail the sea and ocean

H1234.def: = process by which an object is split, either partially or completely, either by supernatural means or by violence

H4599.def: = an opening in the earth that gives access to the subterranean water which either comes to the surface or can be drawn from it; ≈ its water is regarded as a source of blessing

H5158.def: = a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season

H3001.def: = process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause

H386.def: = state of not being subject to change

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H637.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H3974.def: = object that produces or reflects light

H8121.def: = celestial body ► that marks day and night and produces warmth and light for the earth

H5324.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals place themselves in a certain location in an upright position

H1367.def: = a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7019.def: = hot season of the year, opposite of {L:חֹרֶף<SDBH:חֹרֶף>}; ► time when most crops are harvested and preparations are made for the cold season; ≈ sometimes associated with excessive heat and drought, and also with hard work

H2779.def: = cold season of the year; also time of plowing; opposite of {L:קַיִץ<SDBH:קַיִץ>}; ≈ sometimes associated with hard work

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H2778.def: = causative action by which humans make an effort to arouse an emotion of shame in (other) humans or deities; ◄ by their words or actions

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5036.def: = foolish person who has no respect for God or his fellow human beings but thinks highly of himself

H5006.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events, often caused by pride and contempt

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H8449.def: = a bird with a blue-gray color with a pinkish sheen to the neck feathers and a black tip on its tail; lives  in large colonies and eats mainly seeds; courts, mates, and has nests several times a year; nests on rock ledges; ◄ |iColumba livia|i*; ► used as food and for sacrifices; ≈ regarded as swift, docile, and innocent, but also as silly and senseless; associated with affection, fertility and sexuality because of its mating habits; the moaning sound this bird sometimes makes is associated with pain and suffering

H6041.def: = a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

H5331.def: poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

H5027.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H1285.def: = a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

H2555.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans behave aggressively towards other humans, ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H4285.def: = a place where there is little or no light, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, death, and lack of enlightenment

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H1790.def: literally: crushed; hence: = state in which someone is the victim of suffering and humiliation ◄ which feels as if one has been crushed with a heavy object

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H3637.def: = state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done

H6041.def: = a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

H34.def: = person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God

H1984.def: = process by which an object emits or reflects light; ≈ regarded as awesome

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7378.def: = action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way

H7379.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity

H5036.def: = foolish person who has no respect for God or his fellow human beings but thinks highly of himself

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H7588.def: = process by which turbulent waters produce a loud and intimidating noise

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself
